name: Senior Data Analyst / Web Analytics
description:
Rampiq is looking for a Data Digital Analyst to join our team. Your core responsibility will be digital (web and mobile) projects’ analytical systems setup, data visualization, A/B testing setup, and extensive project metrics analysis, and reporting.

You will have direct access to all projects details and clients’ needs and will play a critical role in turning clients’ requests into actions and bringing value to both clients’ and our company business.

You will rest on more routine tasks and you will play a proactive role in projects evolution and growth.

Job responsibilities:

  • Web and mobile analytics systems setup from scratch;

  • Implementation of event tracking using GTM;

  • Enhanced Ecommerce setup (GA4/UA);

  • Google Analytics attribution models / reports;

  • Tracking interactions in mobile analytics;

  • Analytics systems management;

  • Generation of reports based on Google API and marketing systems for internal departments and clients’ teams;

  • Continuous projects performance data analysis and numbers converting into action points;

  • Assistance to SEO and PPC departments with various researches, data analysis requests, etc;

  • Documenting, technical guidance and communicating requirements between both internal and clients’ teams.

Required toolkit:

  • Power Google Analytics user (super-power is even better!);

  • Experience in GTM setup and management;

  • Google Data Studio, MS Power BI, Tableau and other BI systems;

  • Data visualization tools (any of your choice);

  • MS Excel / Google Sheets advanced user (including scripts);

  • Experience in CRM systems integration with Google Analytics (Salesforce, Shopify, Microsoft Dynamics, Magento);

  • Marketing / business intelligence system setup;

  • Understanding of mobile analytics (Firebase, AppsFlyer).

Valuable add-ons:

  • Experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4);

  • Marketing data warehouse setup (Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer certificate) is a huge plus;

  • Advanced reporting using BigQuery;

  • Experience with Google Search Console data analysis;

  • Advertising systems tracking setup (Facebook Pixel, Microsoft Advertising, LinkedIn Ads, etc.);

  • Statistical analysis knowledge;

  • Predictive analytics / forecasting knowledge;

  • R and/or Python is a huge plus;

  • Google Optimize and landing page builders knowledge (Unbounce, Instapage, etc.)

Role requirements:

  • Upper-intermediate to advanced level of written and spoken English;

  • Understanding of digital marketing and web development processes basics;

  • Business analysis course;

  • Understanding of search engines optimization basics;

  • Experience in prototyping, as well as collection, formalization and translation of business requirements is a plus;

  • Industry education (university or commercial courses or major in, statistics or math r);

  • Data science certificates is a plus;

  • Ambition for new knowledge and skills development;

  • Ability to take challenges and learn fast.

Work mode: flexible. Can be full- or part-time and 100% remote.

Compensation: decided upon test task completion and an interview. Please list your salary expectations when you apply for this position.

working_time_intervals.name: Можно работать сменами по 4–6 часов в день
